conclusion: To determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second, we need to analyze the given x-t graph. The graph shows the position of the car as a function of time.
The graph shows a straight line with a positive slope starting at t = -2 seconds and x/t = 10 m/s, and continuing with a constant slope.
At t = 2 seconds, the x/t value on the graph is approximately 20 m/s.

premise: The slope of the x-t graph represents the velocity of the car.
conclusion: The velocity of the car can be determined by calculating the slope of the line at t = 2 seconds.

premise: The slope of the line is constant and represents the change in x divided by the change in t.
conclusion: The slope of the line at t = 2 seconds is 10 m/s.

premise: The velocity of the car at the end of the 2nd second is calculated using the formula v = v_0 + a × t, where v_0 = 10 m/s and a = 10 m/s².
conclusion: The velocity at the end of the 2nd second is v = 10 + 10 × 2 = 30 m/s.
